intro: Ozoroa kassneri, commonly known as the Kassner's ozoroa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
